segments.text: I notice the bright daylight coming through the window above the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's dress and apron make her look so homemaker-like.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then there's all this water overflowing from the basin.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring down the front, soaking everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely unaware, focused on her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is grabbing cookies with glee.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister's arm is up, begging for one too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool doesn't look stable at all; it might give way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor could make anyone slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden path with bushes seems so serene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's funny how the kids think they're so sneaky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool holds just long enough for them to get down safely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is full; they won't go hungry at least.
segments.speaker: PAR
